alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Caldwell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 11:02PM EDT until July 16 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Alexander County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Eastern Caldwell County in western North Carolina... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1102 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lenoir, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Gamewell, Bethlehem, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Cedar Rock, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory, Kings Creek, Little River In Alexander County, Northlakes, Patterson and Ellendale. Numerous reports of flooded roads have been received all across the warned area...especially along the highway 321 and highway 18 corridors. The occurrence of flooded roads thoughout greater Lenoir also will also increase through midnight as one last round of heavy rain moves through. Flooding of low lying areas along many of the tributaries of the Catawba and Yadkin Rivers remain likely, especially throughout the Upper and Lower Little River and Lower Creek basins. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
